segment.source: MD Conversion - Ways to do enterprise mobility
segment.target: MD Conversion - Ways to do enterprise mobility

segment.source: MD Conversion - Ways to do enterprise mobility
segment.target: MD Conversion - Ways to do enterprise mobility

segment.source: Microsoft provides several options for managing your mobile devices.
segment.target: Microsoft provides several options for managing your mobile devices.

segment.source: We’ve provided information on this page to help you decide between these different options for meeting your enterprise mobility needs:
segment.target: We’ve provided information on this page to help you decide between these different options for meeting your enterprise mobility needs:

segment.source: Choose between Intune and MDM for Office 365
segment.target: Choose between Intune and MDM for Office 365

segment.source: Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: Choose between Intune and MDM for Office 365
segment.target: Choose between Intune and MDM for Office 365

segment.source: Included with many Office 365 commercial subscriptions.
segment.target: Included with many Office 365 commercial subscriptions.

segment.source: Requires a paid subscription for Microsoft Intune or can be purchased with the Enterprise Mobility Suite.
segment.target: Requires a paid subscription for Microsoft Intune or can be purchased with the Enterprise Mobility Suite.

segment.source: Manage devices using the Office 365 admin center.
segment.target: Manage devices using the Office 365 admin center.

segment.source: If you use by itself, you manage devices using the Intune admin console.
segment.target: If you use by itself, you manage devices using the Intune admin console.

segment.source: If you integrate Intune with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, you use the Configuration Manager console to manage devices on-premises and in the cloud.
segment.target: If you integrate Intune with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, you use the Configuration Manager console to manage devices on-premises and in the cloud.

segment.source: Cloud-based management for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone
segment.target: Cloud-based management for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone

segment.source: Cloud-based management for iOS, Mac OS X, Android, Windows Phone, and Windows PCs
segment.target: Cloud-based management for iOS, Mac OS X, Android, Windows Phone, and Windows PCs

segment.source: Ensure that Office 365 corporate email and documents can be accessed only on phones and tablets that are managed by your company and that are compliant with your IT policies.
segment.target: Ensure that Office 365 corporate email and documents can be accessed only on phones and tablets that are managed by your company and that are compliant with your IT policies.

segment.source: Set and manage security policies, like device level pin lock and jailbreak detection, to help prevent unauthorized users from accessing corporate email and data on a device when it is lost or stolen.
segment.target: Set and manage security policies, like device level pin lock and jailbreak detection, to help prevent unauthorized users from accessing corporate email and data on a device when it is lost or stolen.

segment.source: Remove Office 365 company data from an employee’s device while leaving their personal data in place.
segment.target: Remove Office 365 company data from an employee’s device while leaving their personal data in place.

segment.source: For the latest information about Office 365 MDM capabilities, see capabilities of Built-in Mobile Device Management for Office 365.
segment.target: For the latest information about Office 365 MDM capabilities, see capabilities of Built-in Mobile Device Management for Office 365.

segment.source: Help users securely access corporate resource with certificates, Wi-Fi, VPN, and email profiles.
segment.target: Help users securely access corporate resource with certificates, Wi-Fi, VPN, and email profiles.

segment.source: Enroll and manage collections of corporate-owned devices, simplifying policy and app deployment.
segment.target: Enroll and manage collections of corporate-owned devices, simplifying policy and app deployment.

segment.source: Deploy your internal line-of-business apps and apps in stores to users.
segment.target: Deploy your internal line-of-business apps and apps in stores to users.

segment.source: Enable your users to securely access corporate information using the Office mobile and line-of business apps they know, while ensuring security of data by restricting actions like copy, cut, paste, and save as, to only those apps managed by .
segment.target: Enable your users to securely access corporate information using the Office mobile and line-of business apps they know, while ensuring security of data by restricting actions like copy, cut, paste, and save as, to only those apps managed by .

segment.source: Enable secure web browsing using the Managed Browser app.
segment.target: Enable secure web browsing using the Managed Browser app.

segment.source: Manage PC's from the cloud with no infrastructure required using , or connect to to manage all of your devices including PCs, Macs, Linux and UNIX servers, and mobile devices from a single management console.
segment.target: Manage PC's from the cloud with no infrastructure required using , or connect to to manage all of your devices including PCs, Macs, Linux and UNIX servers, and mobile devices from a single management console.

segment.source: Starting in October 2015, administrators can manage users and their mobile devices using both Intune and Office 365 concurrently on the same tenant.
segment.target: Starting in October 2015, administrators can manage users and their mobile devices using both Intune and Office 365 concurrently on the same tenant.

segment.source: This lets you decided which solution is the best solution for specific users and their corresponding devices.
segment.target: This lets you decided which solution is the best solution for specific users and their corresponding devices.

segment.source: You can then specify whether a user and his or her devices are managed with Office 365 MDM or the more feature-rich Intune management solution.
segment.target: You can then specify whether a user and his or her devices are managed with Office 365 MDM or the more feature-rich Intune management solution.

segment.source: Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: You might choose + Configuration Manager if:
segment.target: You might choose + Configuration Manager if:

segment.source: You want to manage mobile devices
segment.target: You want to manage mobile devices

segment.source: You want to manage computers that are not joined to a domain
segment.target: You want to manage computers that are not joined to a domain

segment.source: You have fewer than 50,000 devices to manage
segment.target: You have fewer than 50,000 devices to manage

segment.source: You have no (or limited) on-premises IT infrastructure
segment.target: You have no (or limited) on-premises IT infrastructure

segment.source: does not require on-premises IT infrastructure, however it can use the capabilities of Exchange ActiveSync or Active Directory Domain Services if you have those installed.
segment.target: does not require on-premises IT infrastructure, however it can use the capabilities of Exchange ActiveSync or Active Directory Domain Services if you have those installed.

segment.source: You have a mobile or highly distributed workforce.
segment.target: You have a mobile or highly distributed workforce.

segment.source: Cloud-based device management lets you manage mobile devices and computers anywhere in the world.
segment.target: Cloud-based device management lets you manage mobile devices and computers anywhere in the world.

segment.source: You want to manage computers joined to a domain.
segment.target: You want to manage computers joined to a domain.

segment.source: You want to manage computers with the Configuration Manager client, Mac computers, Linux and UNIX server, and mobile devices enrolled with Intune from the same console.
segment.target: You want to manage computers with the Configuration Manager client, Mac computers, Linux and UNIX server, and mobile devices enrolled with Intune from the same console.

segment.source: You have more than 50,000 devices to manage.
segment.target: You have more than 50,000 devices to manage.

segment.source: You have on-premises IT infrastructure in place, or plan to deploy such infrastructure.
segment.target: You have on-premises IT infrastructure in place, or plan to deploy such infrastructure.

segment.source: In this configuration, the device and resource management experience is fully unified.
segment.target: In this configuration, the device and resource management experience is fully unified.

segment.source: User names and passwords are synchronized, providing users with a single account that they use to access company resources, whether from a domain-joined computer or from a mobile device.
segment.target: User names and passwords are synchronized, providing users with a single account that they use to access company resources, whether from a domain-joined computer or from a mobile device.

segment.source: The following tables compare the device and app management capabilities available to you when you use alone, Configuration Manager alone, or a solution that uses both products.
segment.target: The following tables compare the device and app management capabilities available to you when you use alone, Configuration Manager alone, or a solution that uses both products.

segment.source: To learn more about using Configuration Manager with , see Manage Mobile Devices with Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn more about using Configuration Manager with , see Manage Mobile Devices with Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2 and
segment.target: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2 and

segment.source: Where indicated with (R2), the listed capability requires Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager or later.
segment.target: Where indicated with (R2), the listed capability requires Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager or later.

segment.source: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2 and
segment.target: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2 and

segment.source: Deploy and customize Windows PC device configuration settings (e.g., WMI, registry)
segment.target: Deploy and customize Windows PC device configuration settings (e.g., WMI, registry)

segment.source: Deploy and customize Mac OS X configuration settings
segment.target: Deploy and customize Mac OS X configuration settings

segment.source: Deploy configuration settings to mobile devices.
segment.target: Deploy configuration settings to mobile devices.

segment.source: Deploy custom mobile device settings (such as OMA-URI and Apple Configurator)
segment.target: Deploy custom mobile device settings (such as OMA-URI and Apple Configurator)

segment.source: Deploy apps to devices and Windows PCs
segment.target: Deploy apps to devices and Windows PCs

segment.source: Monitor malware on Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Monitor malware on Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection

segment.source: Monitor and report on how often software is being used with software metering
segment.target: Monitor and report on how often software is being used with software metering

segment.source: Extend hardware and software inventory for Windows PCs
segment.target: Extend hardware and software inventory for Windows PCs

segment.source: Use role-based administration and reporting to control who has access to product capabilites
segment.target: Use role-based administration and reporting to control who has access to product capabilites

segment.source: Run reports for Windows PCs and enrolled mobile devices from the same console
segment.target: Run reports for Windows PCs and enrolled mobile devices from the same console

segment.source: Customize existing reports, and write your own reports using SQL Server Reporting Services
segment.target: Customize existing reports, and write your own reports using SQL Server Reporting Services

segment.source: Deploy security settings to mobile devices
segment.target: Deploy security settings to mobile devices

segment.source: Manage access to Exchange email and SharePoint with conditional access
segment.target: Manage access to Exchange email and SharePoint with conditional access

segment.source: App compliance policies (compliant and noncompliant apps)
segment.target: App compliance policies (compliant and noncompliant apps)
